ygData.subject: Re: What is the best way to raise faction level with the Merchants of Felwithe?
ygData.msgSnippet: You couldn t be more wrong.  The faction system makes you explore different areas of the game to find ways to improve your faction.  If they just told you how
ygData.messageBody:
You couldn't be more wrong. The faction system makes you explore different
areas of the game to find ways to improve your faction. If they just told
you how to improve or destroy your faction with any races then why have it.
Why would a DE be allowed to enter or even buy from venders of Good diety?
The faction system allows for a person to create their own destiny by
choosing which faction they wish to increase and hunting that method out.

In Guk there are two factions of Frogloks, Good and Undead (Ghoul). At
the begining if you do not harm any Good frogloks and head into Guk and get
attacked by a Ghoul froglok, you can run to a good froglok and he will
protect you just like a guard would in your city. This of course depends on
your starting faction with them. Without a faction system then you will get
attack by everyone of them.

Just my 2 cps worth.


Shadair J'Axx
32 Wizard
The Chosen Ones
Karana


----- Original Message -----
From: Tom Bratina
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Sent: Wednesday, July 07, 1999 12:21 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] What is the best way to raise faction level with
the Merchants of Felwithe?


well, i don't have an answer for u, but i think Verant royally screwed up
with the PC faction system they implemented. anyway, i say if Verant is
going to continue with this patsy faction crap, they need to at least post
how u can alter ur faction in a positive manner. or just totally remove the
stupid friggin PC faction system.

just my rant.

sinlaru ce`alen
rallos zek
-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Browne <mbrowne@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, July 07, 1999 10:48 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] What is the best way to raise faction level with
the Merchants of Felwithe?


Hello, fellow Wizards!

Several weeks ago I participated in a guild war and slew a High Elf not
knowing that there would be a faction hit as a result. Well, I can no longer
purchase or sell items in Felwithe. I've tried everything that I know of to
improve my faction standing with the Merchants there, but to no avail. My
faction standing with the guards is "amiable" -- It is with the "Merchants"
that I need a faction adjustment. Does anyone have any ideas? Suggestions?
Personal experience? Would appreciate any and all advice.

Wizzy Lightseeker
L25 Gnome Wizard
Solusek Ro
